results.title: Atenolol versus adrenaline eye drops and an evaluation of these two combined.
results.text_hl: There was no significant difference between the @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypotension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015814 @@@ocular hypotensive@@@ effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-then-@CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@adrenaline@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@adrenaline@@@-then-@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Effects of antiglaucoma drugs on [32P]orthophosphate incorporation into phospholipids of cat iris and ciliary process.
results.text_hl: The beta blocking @<m>DISEASE_Ocular_Hypotension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015814 @@@ocular hypotensive drugs@@@, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, produced varying effects on @CHEMICAL_Phosphorus_32 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C000615311 @@@32P@@@ incorporation into @CHEMICAL_Phospholipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010743 @@@phospholipids@@@ of iris and ciliary process.

citations.NLM: Yorio T, DeLoach G, Satumtira N. Effects of antiglaucoma drugs on [32P]orthophosphate incorporation into phospholipids of cat iris and ciliary process. J Ocul Pharmacol. 1985 Fall;1(3):245-54. PMID: 3880077
